p: In vitro infected macrophages from DNA-PROT vaccinated hamsters produced a significantly higher quantity of NO than those from the C group (Mann-Whitney U; P = 0.029), while no differences were observed between DNA or PROT groups and the C group ( Figure 1). No significant differences were found between the number of amastigotes infecting macrophages from the vaccinated groups and the C group at 72 h post- in vitro infection (Mann-Whitney U; P > 0.050 for all comparisons).
